title: Desktop Support II
description:
Are you looking for a hybrid or remote work opportunity? Are you ready for a workplace that provides benefits that suit your needs? Do you seek a workplace where you grow and transform your career? 

We are Relativity. A market-leading, global tech company that equips legal and compliance professionals with a powerful platform to organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. The US Department of Justice, 199 of the Am Law 200, and more than 329,000 enabled users trust Relativity during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects. 

Our SaaS product, RelativityOne, has become the fastest-growing product in the company's history and we have consistently been named a great workplace. As we grow, we continue to seek individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team. 

The IT Operations Support team manages all IT-related service requests from employees. The Desktop Support (Analyst) II provides computer, device, hardware, software, storage, networking and operation support to company employees, with in-depth knowledge of desktops, communications systems, and a high level of customer support expertise. You will be an escalation point for Desktop Support I. This role will report into the Manager of IT Operations. This is a hybrid role based in Chicago, IL.

Your Role in Action:

  • Oversee new employee device set ups, user accounts, and access to resources
  • Help manage hardware and software assets and inventory (SCCM and JAMF)
  • Manage onboarding, off-boarding, knowledge base article creation, and training around our collaboration and communication tools for end-users and end-user support personnel
  • Help create SOPs to help all employees to make the best use of our supplied tools
  • Be an escalation point for service desk and desktop support requests
  • Respond to requests for assistance and contribute to an online knowledge base to enhance end-user knowledge base
  • Provide remote on-call support on assigned shift coverage
  • Troubleshoot deployments, view logs and provide support for managed devices and systems including Microsoft Endpoint Manager, SCCM and JAMF
  • Office infrastructure support; network, desktop hardware (docks, monitors) and print servers
  • Work with team leadership to plan upgrades, deployments, and project-based work
  • Assist with inventory management and ordering with our vendors
  • Stay up to date with new hardware products relevant to our workstations
  • Assist with troubleshooting advanced android and iOS issues (software only)
  • Track all help desk interactions
  • Demonstrate commitment to core company values

Your Skills:

  • 3+ years of experience
  • Experience explaining technical concepts in non-technical terms to ensure end-user understanding
  • Knowledge of general operating systems (e.g., Windows 10, OS X, iOS, Android)
  • Knowledge of general desktop hardware, software, modern browsers and networking concepts.
  • Experience providing support for enterprise applications such as Zoom, Slack, Workday, Okta, and Tableau
  • Experience with Apple device solutions (e.g., iPads, Macbook Pro, iMac) and Apple/Windows deployment technologies.
  • Knowledge of ITIL Foundations
  • Implement logical, progressive troubleshooting processes

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Benefit Highlights:

Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans

Parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Long-term incentive program

Training investment program

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Contracts Specialist
description:
How will you make an impact?

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

This role can be based at our sites in Carlsbad, CA (San Diego area), Waltham, MA (Boston area), South San Francisco, Hillsborough, OR (Portland area) or Austin, TX. Other locations, including remote, may be considered for experienced candidates.

What will you do?

As a part of Thermo Fisher’s Intellectual Property team, you will enable biotech and large pharma customers to deliver breakthrough medicines to patients. You will be a member of the global License Management team and your key responsibilities will include:

  • Managing contract intake of in- and out-licenses.
  • Working with other team members in the Legal, Marketing, Product Management, New Product Introduction, R&D, and Licensing departments to support license-related projects and processes
  • Managing end-user license agreement submission and review process.
  • Providing support for scientific/intellectual property/license-based initiatives as required.

Keys to Success:

Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree, or the equivalent knowledge and experience.

Experience

  • Minimum 7 years of work experience, with 3-4 years in paralegal, legal operations, or contract management.
  • Preference for experience in a life science or biotechnology company and/or technology transfer office.
  • Experience with license agreements is highly desirable.
  • Experience with analytic software tools, such as Power BI preferred
  • Experience in project or process management preferred

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills, strong initiative, results-orientation, collaborative/team instinct, and can-do attitude.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage complex, fast paced projects and effectively support and interact with different functions and roles across the company.
  • The abilities to work independently, prioritize projects, multi-task, and work well within an interdisciplinary team.
  • Desire to learn new skills and step outside traditional tasks including exposure to or interest in project management frameworks.

Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Accessibility/Disability Access

Job Seekers with a Disability: Thermo Fisher Scientific offers accessibility service for job seekers requiring accommodations in the job application process. For example, this may include individuals requiring assistance because of hearing, vision, mobility, or cognitive impairments. If you are a job seeker with a disability, or assisting a person with a disability, and require accessibility assistance or an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please submit a request by telephone at 1-855-471-2255*. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.

*This telephone line is reserved solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes, such as not being able to get into the career website, following up on an application, or other non-disability related technical issues will not receive a response.

title: Contracts Manager
description:
About Pinterest:  

Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more. 

The Commercial Legal Team at Pinterest negotiates Pinterest’s inbound and supplier agreements. We are looking for a Contracts Manager with a strong background in independently negotiating a high volume of low risk standard form commercial vendor agreements. As the first point of contact for internal business partners you will be responsible for ensuring our clients understand what we do and why we do it (through communication, training, documentation, etc.) and ensuring that our clients have a seamless, efficient and positive experience. The position will perform legal review and negotiation of our low spend, low risk commercial vendor agreements, provide back-up/overflow coverage for our Specialty Agreements (Events/Speaker Agreements, Communities Agreements, Confidential Agreements), as well as assist the Senior Contracts Manager with the day-to-day operations of Ironclad assignments for contracts analysts. This role will also provide support in a Lead capacity, providing coaching/mentoring, training, and audit of contracts analysts work.  You should have experience working with templates, be able to effectively identify gaps and/or redundancies in processes, provide solutions and recommendations to solve potential issues, and effectively implement new processes.

What you’ll do:

  • Triage and perform legal review and negotiation of our low risk commercial vendor agreements 
  • Provide back-up and overflow support for specialty agreements (i.e. speaker/event agreements, communities agreements, confidential agreements, etc.)   
  • Lead with a “business first” attitude that ensures our clients have a seamless, efficient and positive experience with the Commercial Legal Team.  
  • Partner closely with contracts managers to develop processes and systems to scale globally
  • Proactively develop and update business processes for identified waste and re-work to help prepare the Commercial Legal team to scale globally 
  • Provide guidance, mentorship to team members, as well as develop and train contract analysts on new work processes or initiatives
  • Review and audit work of contracts analysts to identify where there may be areas for improvement
  • Field questions from attorneys, contracts analysts and contract managers or XFN business partners on our business processes or Ironclad questions
  • Act as a liaison to XFN business partners for escalated matters
  • Monitor the Contracts-Legal alias (email inbox) and NDA alias and workflows and respond promptly and thoroughly to queries received  

What we’re looking for: 

  • 5+ years of experience negotiating commercial vendor agreements (preferably with at least 1 year in-house)
  • Effective communicator, both written and verbal 
  • You are able to distill and communicate highly nuanced legal positions within Pinterest in a clear, concise, compelling manner
  • You consistently exhibit strong judgment in ambiguous or challenging situations
  • A collaborative team player who likes nurturing business relationships and fostering an environment where ideas and creative thinking is encouraged 
  • A problem solver who can anticipate needs and offer solutions
  • Experience in building processes to scale a growing commercial team (including template and provision libraries, automation in review, standard responses, and playbooks)

#LI-HC

#LI-REMOTE 

Our Commitment to Diversity:

At Pinterest, our mission is to bring everyone the inspiration to create a life they love—and that includes our employees. We’re taking on the most exciting challenges of our working lives, and we succeed with a team that represents an inclusive and diverse set of identities and backgrounds.

title: Contracts Coordinator
description:
This position is responsible for the day-to-day administration of contract management processes and interfaces between stakeholders, that may include business owners, vendors, as well as the contracts and subcontracts team, program management, business development, compliance, and legal. Facilitates contract actions and processes independently and effectively.

  • Assists in the preparation of responses to request for quotes/proposals (RFQ/RFP).
  • Reviews RFQ/RFP for subcontract flow down requirements.
  • Collaborates with the contracts and subcontracts teams to create and revise systems and procedures by analyzing practices, reporting requirements, and archiving guidelines.
  • Collaborates with contract and subcontract managers in the review and preparation of support documents for agreements, amendments, and contract extensions for review, approval and full execution.
  • Coordinates execution of approved documents, updates status in system and assists with the distribution of documents, both internally and externally.
  • Assists with resolves billing and invoicing issues.
  • Maintains contract management system.
  • Performs special tasks and assignments as required by management.
  • Serves as key contact for the contract management system.
  • Prepares and coordinates non-disclosure agreements and teaming agreements.
  • Negotiates and executes standard non-disclosure agreements (NDAs).
  • Maintains contractual documentation and file set-up information including contract agreements, modifications, task/delivery orders, funding status, invoicing status, representations/certifications, and correspondence.
  • Processes and sets up contracts, modifications, etc. through company's approval.

Other Job Requirements

Responsibilities

3+ years of applicable experience (i.e., procurement or contracting).

Strong organizational skills demonstrated across a range of supplier and commercial contexts.

Excellent written and verbal communication, project coordination, leadership and interpersonal skills.

Proficient in the use of spreadsheets, database and word-processing applications.

Ability to rapidly establish credibility and relationships with a broad range of individuals.

Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.

Ability to work in disparate programs/systems and understand how they interact (Cobblestone, RITA, Compliance360).General Job Information

Title

Contracts Coordinator - Remote

Grade

23

Work Experience - Required

Contract Administration and Management

﻿Work Experience - Preferred

Education - Required

BachelorsEducation - Preferred

License and Certifications - Required

License and Certifications - Preferred

Magellan Health, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Tobacco-free workplace. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled.

Every employee must understand, comply with and attest to the security responsibilities and security controls unique to their position; and comply with all applicable legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements and internal policies and procedures.

title: Strategic Marketing Comm Analyst II
description:
Job Description

About Conduent

Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments – creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them.

You have an opportunity to personally thrive, make a difference and be part of a culture where individuality is noticed and valued every day.

Job Description

Job Track Description:

  • Requires formal education and relevant expertise in a professional, sales, or technical area.
  • Performs technical-based activities.
  • Contributes to and manages projects.
  • Uses deductive reasoning to solve problems and make recommendations.
  • Interfaces with and influences key stakeholders.
  • Leverages previous knowledge and expertise to achieve results.
  • Ability to complete work self-guided and with a team.
  • College or university degree required.

General Profile

  • Requires knowledge and experience in the field.
  • Will acquire higher-level knowledge and skills.
  • Develops an understanding of the company, processes, and customers.
  • Uses existing procedures to solve standard problems.
  • Receives moderate guidance and direction from others.

Functional Knowledge

  • Requires expanded conceptual understanding of theories, practices, and procedures.

Business Expertise

  • Uses an understanding of key business drivers to accomplish work.

Impact

  • Impacts a team, by example, through the quality service and information provided.
  • Follows standardized procedures and practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlines.

Leadership

  • No supervisory responsibilities.
  • Provides informal guidance to new team members.

Problem Solving

  • Uses existing procedures and technical experience to solve problems.

Interpersonal Skills

  • Exchanges complex information and ideas effectively.

Responsibility Statements

  • Applies communications expertise to create, edit, print, and deliver client communications.
  • Coordinates and reviews communications deliverables following the defined workflow guidelines.
  • Manages inventory and coordinates re-ordering requests with internal and external print vendors.
  • Provides extensive deliverable support during Annual Enrollment.
  • Manages rounds of edits and reviews submissions.
  • Manages project deliverables and timelines, supporting cross-functional communication needs.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
  • Complies with all policies and standards.

Closing

Conduent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, gender expression, sex/gender, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law.

People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply for or compete for employment with Conduent may request such accommodation(s) by clicking on the following link, completing the accommodation request form, and submitting the request by using the “Submit” button at the bottom of the form. For those using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox please download the form first: click here to access or download the form. You may also click here to access Conduent’s ADAAA Accommodation Policy.

At Conduent we value the health and safety of our associates, their families and our community. For US applicants while we DO NOT require vaccination for most of our jobs, we DO require that you provide us with your vaccination status, where legally permissible. Providing this information is a requirement of your employment at Conduent.

title: Partner Marketing Coordinator
description:
Company Description

Jitterbit is a market-leading Enterprise Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) & API Management (API-M) solution provider recognized by Gartner as a Leader in the Magic Quadrant for 6 years in a row!

Jitterbit helps businesses make faster, more effective decisions by enabling them to unify and exploit data from all sources.

Using the Jitterbit API integration platform companies can rapidly connect SaaS, on-premises and cloud applications and instantly infuse artificial intelligence into any business process. Our intuitive API creation technology enables companies to reuse business-critical applications and data to bring new offerings to market in days, not months.

Job Description

We currently have an opportunity for a highly motivated, detailed, and pro-active Partner Marketing Coordinator to join our Global Partner Marketing team. This is an exciting opportunity to help drive and build partner programs for new and existing Jitterbit partners. Working closely with the Senior Manager, Partner Marketing; Programs Alliances, Sales, and Marketing teams, you will collaborate with key stakeholders to maintain, expand, and create joint market reach, combined with brand awareness, and increase demand for both new logo and expansion business. This role will help drive growth through development and execution of initiatives such as content creation, demand generation, sales enablement, and partner communications. You will own the on-going management of the Jitterbit Partner Portal, including partner onboarding, training and development of with-Partner and thru-Partner marketing programs, campaigns, collateral, and events. In addition, you will support the build of resources, documents and planning for the new Partner Program. The ideal candidate must be creative, analytical, organized, data-driven, and results-oriented with a strong bias for action, the ability to meet deadlines, thrive in cross-functional and collaborative organizations, and is driven by the impact and support of change they will bring to the organization. What you’ll be doing ● Helping to develop, execute, and automate Partner Onboarding ● Managing the Jitterbit Partner Portal, maintaining new content, campaigns, and updates ● Leading the ongoing execution of our Partner Recognition Program with global stakeholders ● Supporting the evolution and maintenance of JItterbits Partner Program documentation, processes ● Working with sales and SMEs to enable sales activities through the development and refinement of sales presentations and collateral ● Using data efficiently to maintain and create dashboards and reporting for end-to-end partner programs in conjunction with Alliances, Sales, and Product teams ● Implementing and managing intake request process for the Partner Marketing Team to measure and scale work across team members ● Participating in projects and initiatives to ensure partner team alignment with goals and objectives associated with Jitterbit partner strategy ● Coordinating monthly newsletters, webinars, public website partner pages and other content and events ● Willing to execute and dive into new projects and programs as they are presented

Qualifications

● Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Marketing, Communications, or related field ● 1- 3 years relevant experience ● Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to create, assemble and coordinate content ● Solid project and time management skills ● Proficiency with Microsoft Office ● Detail-oriented and highly organized individual with the ability to multitask ● Strong interpersonal skills, highly-motivated, proactive, and accountable ● Team player, self-starter with a passion for storytelling who will demonstrate a commitment to elevating the group’s marketing mission ● Ability to work under pressure to manage multiple priorities, often with competing and tight deadlines

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
